Text: The racial inequities that exist in our society are evident all around us.Just look at #COVID19.Communities of color are overwhelmingly impacted.We must continue to work toward a more just, equitable future.

Supposedly Donald Trump is thinking of having a listening session with black leaders. FOR WHAT? Trump and his people are racists and will never change. Even if they listen they aren't going to do a damned thing about racism. Most republicans don't think racism is a problem anyway

This shouldn't surprise anyone. Donald Trump has a long record of promoting, extolling, inciting state-sponsored violence and "domination". He's a thug and a supporter of thugs. Remember his praise for China over Tiananmen Square in 1990?
@chicagosmayor @LoriLightfoot As a black queer woman, your silence has been deafening. Call for Malcoms release IMMEDIATELY

For the first time since 1889, the lights of the White House were turned off, The President Donald Trump takes refuge in the bunker, and fires are started in the surroundings. Explosions, protests and injuries reported in Washington, D.C.#BlackLivesMatter https://t.co/I6m9khHvlv
Remember when Trump and his sycophants kept saying Biden was hiding in his basement? ~ Turns out Trump is ACTUALLY the one hiding in the basement. #BunkerTrump https://t.co/bsH41prq7q

I'm well aware that there is little Trump can do on a nuts and bolts level to stop the rioting and burning and looting. But even his staunchest supporters have got to be thinking about just how pathetic it is that he has gone completely AWOL as a public figure.
Choose to celebrate life over #COVID19 deaths.  While the liberal media celebrates the deaths, you can live beyond the virus. Chose to celebrate:  https://t.co/D8rI81hX28
The president who has spent the last few weeks condemning the overreach of FISA wants government to track people arrested during the protests. https://t.co/wCSKkYiOBT

What a role reversal. After spending two months in the basement while Trump dominated Covid-19 coverage.... Biden takes center stage amid race protests while POTUS reliqunshes the head-of-state spotlight.
